title: The 8 stages of Liverpool fans' roller coaster relationship with their manager
text:
The 8 stages of Liverpool fans' roller coaster relationship with their manager Adulation to anger - and everything in between Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Jurgen Klopp speaks after Leicester defeat Share this video     
Is anyone else getting a sense of deja vu about now? 
Following their dismantling at the hands of Leicester City , Liverpool fans have begun turning on manager Jurgen Klopp. 
Stage 1: The new boss arrives LIVERPOOL, UNITED KINGDOM - JUNE 01: Brendan Rodgers is unveiled as the new Liverpool FC manager at a press conference at Anfield on June 01, 2012 in Liverpool, England. (Photo by Clint Hughes/Getty Images) (Photo: Clint Hughes) 
This is greeted with huge fanfare and an immediate belief that "this is the man who'll take us back where we belong, the top of the table." 
Stage 2: Results don't really change 
But it's alright - the last manager was so bad, fans understand he needs another one (or two) transfer windows to undo all the wrongs the last bloke in charge did. 
*PIC OF A RUBBISH SIGNING WITH RECENT MANAGER* 
Stage 3: Eventually things improve and fans love them (Photo: Sportimage/PA Images) 
Stage 4: They come close - but don't win anything Steven Gerrard slips and allows Demba Ba to score for Chelsea (Photo: Getty) 
Stage 5: Results deteriorate and goodwill evaporates LONDON, ENGLAND - MAY 05: Manager Kenny Dalglish of Liverpool looks dejected during the FA Cup Final with Budweiser between Liverpool and Chelsea at Wembley Stadium on May 5, 2012 in London, England. (Photo by Michael Regan - The FA/The FA via Getty Images) (Photo: Michael Regan - The FA) 
Stage 6: The board is blamed as results get worse 
Stage 7: #ManagerOUT starts trending after every game, regardless of result LEICESTER, ENGLAND - FEBRUARY 27: (THE SUN OUT, THE SUN ON SUNDAY OUT) Jurgen Klopp Manager of Liverpool during the Premier League match between Leicester City and Liverpool at The King Power Stadium on February 27, 2017 in Leicester, England. (Photo by Andrew Powell/Liverpool FC via Getty Images) (Photo: Andrew Powell) 
Stage 8: Sacked 
...and the the cycle starts all over again. Never change, Liverpool fans. Never change. poll loading Should Liverpool sack Jurgen Klopp? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
